Class Display

java.lang.Object
  Display

public final class Display
extends java.lang.Object

A singleton class to control the Lego NXT controller brick's single LCD display. On each line the display will print one key/value mapping. Ordering can only be guaranteed when using reserve(String...) to reserve multiple lines at once. In such a case the array of mappings are guaranteed to occupy successive lines. Updates are drawn immediately.

THREAD SAFE

          Clears the display mappings.

Method Detail

reserve

public static int reserve(java.lang.String... keys)
Reserves successive lines for the desired array of keys. Lines are allocated to keys following the array ordering, so if fewer lines than keys are available the first keys are given priority.

Parameters:
keys - The keys to reserve
Returns:
How many keys where successfuly reserved

update

public static boolean update(java.lang.String key,
                             java.lang.String val)
Updates a mapping, adding a new one if necessary. Since only a limited number of lines are available on the display, this method returns the success of the update as: false if no line is free, true if the mapping have been given a line. Once the mapping are displayed on a line, they get to keep the line until either remove(String) or clear() is called. This causes a display refresh.

Parameters:
key - The key for the mapping
val - The value for the mapping
Returns:
Whether or not the update succeeded

remove

public static void remove(java.lang.String key)
Removes a mapping from the display. The line is freed. All lines bellow are shifted up.

Parameters:
key - The key of the mapping to remove

clear

public static void clear()
Clears the display mappings. Use with caution as this will affect the way other threads will have their data displayed (potentially messing up the ordering).
